definition: to put pen to paper/pen mark
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: Luobi Cave was an origin habitation area that Hainan's people lived in that was over 10 thousand years ago.
sentences.chinese: 落筆洞是距今一萬多年前最初的海南人居住的地方。

sentences.english: I have lots of ideas for short stories but find it difficult to put pen to paper .
sentences.chinese: 我有許多寫短篇小說的題材，但發現難於落筆。

sentences.english: Would you strokes be tremblingly timid or brilliantly bold?
sentences.chinese: 你落筆時會顫抖膽怯，還是敏銳果敢？

sentences.english: An instance of being imperfectly known or difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 我有許多寫短篇小說的題材，但發現難於落筆。

sentences.english: The destiny of all people will be in this start to write or draw.
sentences.chinese: 所有的人的命運都將在此落筆。

definition: to put pen to paper
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
to take up one's pen/to start to write
third and fourth lines (in an eight-line poem) which form a couplet
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
couplet
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
a snap of the fingers/a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
(of literature, art) distinct style/flavor/spirit/character
to open a book/open-book (exam)
to versify/to compose poetry
muddy/to mix
to wield the pen/to write
old verse/poetry in the old style
hero/towering figure
